news.Title: Tower Semiconductor Partners with LightIC to Expand Silicon Photonics Beyond AI Infrastructure into Physical AI and Automotive
news.Content:
This is a paid press release. Contact the press release distributor directly with any inquiries.

Tower Semiconductor Partners with LightIC to Expand Silicon Photonics Beyond AI Infrastructure into Physical AI and Automotive

Tower Semiconductor
Mon, January 5, 2026 at 3:00 AM PST 4 min read

In this article: TSEM

Leveraging Tower‚Äôs Mature Silicon Photonics Foundry Platform to Enable Scalable FMCW LiDAR
MIGDAL HAEMEK, Israel, and SAN JOSE, CA. ‚Äì January 05, 2026 ‚Äì Tower Semiconductor (NASDAQ/TASE: TSEM), a leading foundry of high-value analog semiconductor solutions, and LightIC Technologies (‚ÄúLightIC‚Äù), a developer of silicon photonics‚Äìbased FMCW LiDAR solutions, today announced a strategic collaboration leveraging Tower‚Äôs mature silicon photonics platform to support LightIC‚Äôs Frequency-Modulated Continuous-Wave (FMCW) LiDAR products, including the Lark‚Ñ¢ long-range automotive LiDAR and the FR60‚Ñ¢ compact LiDAR for robotics and Physical AI applications.

According to the latest research from Yole Group, the global automotive LiDAR market is projected to grow from $859 million in 2024 to $3.6 billion by 2030, representing a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 24%. This growth is a key component of the broader LiDAR landscape, which Yole expects to reach $6.3 billion by 2027 as the technology expands into industrial automation, smart infrastructure, and robotics.
The continued scaling of AI data-center networking has accelerated silicon photonics process maturity and manufacturability, expanding its adoption in systems requiring tightly integrated optical functionality. Tower Semiconductor‚Äôs advanced silicon photonics platform, widely utilized in large-scale AI infrastructure deployments, provides a strategic foundation for extending silicon photonics into sensing-driven Physical AI and automotive applications. LightIC Technologies applies this platform to FMCW LiDAR, integrating the optical functions required for coherent ranging and instantaneous velocity sensing directly onto silicon. As SiPho based FMCW LiDAR technology rapidly matures, it is expected to capture larger share of the global LiDAR market analogous to the rapid growth of silicon photonics-based components in data-center networking.

‚ÄúWe are excited to expand our silicon photonics market beyond that of AI infrastructure into new sensing applications,‚Äù said Dr. Ed Preisler, Vice President and General Manager of RF Business Unit at Tower Semiconductor . ‚ÄúOur joint work with LightIC and its team of experts is a key step in bringing to market velocity-aware sensing for robotics, Physical AI and automotive markets.‚Äù
The collaboration combines LightIC‚Äôs silicon photonic design capabilities with Tower‚Äôs silicon photonics manufacturing platform to enable higher levels of optical integration and improvements in size, weight, power, and cost (SWaP-C), supporting the transition of velocity-aware LiDAR from advanced development into real-world automotive and Physical AI deployment.

Story Continues
‚ÄúUtilizing Tower‚Äôs silicon photonics process enables us to integrate complex coherent LiDAR optical functions into silicon on a scalable, manufacturable platform suitable for product qualification and long-term production,‚Äù said Jie Sun, CEO and Co-Founder of LightIC . ‚ÄúThis level of integration is fundamental to delivering commercially viable 4D FMCW LiDAR solutions for automotive and Physical AI applications.‚Äù

For additional information about Tower Semiconductor‚Äôs SiPho technology platform, visit here .
For more information about LightIC, please visit www.lightictech.com.
About Tower Semiconductor
Tower Semiconductor Ltd. (NASDAQ/TASE: TSEM), the leading foundry of high-value analog semiconductor solutions, provides technology, development, and process platforms for its customers in growing markets such as consumer, industrial, automotive, mobile, infrastructure, medical and aerospace and defense. Tower Semiconductor focuses on creating a positive and sustainable impact on the world through long-term partnerships and its advanced and innovative analog technology offering, comprised of a broad range of customizable process platforms such as SiGe, BiCMOS, mixed-signal/CMOS, RF CMOS, CMOS image sensor, non-imaging sensors, displays, integrated power management (BCD and 700V), photonics, and MEMS. Tower Semiconductor also provides world-class design enablement for a quick and accurate design cycle as well as process transfer services including development, transfer, and optimization, to IDMs and fabless companies. To provide multi-fab sourcing and extended capacity for its customers, Tower Semiconductor owns one operating facility in Israel (200mm), two in the U.S. (200mm), two in Japan (200mm and 300mm) which it owns through its 51% holdings in TPSCo, shares a 300mm facility in Agrate, Italy with STMicroelectronics as well as has access to a 300mm capacity corridor in Intel‚Äôs New Mexico factory. For more information, please visit: www.towersemi.com .

Safe Harbor Regarding Forward-Looking Statements
This press release includes forward-looking statements, which are subject to risks and uncertainties. Actual results may vary from those projected or implied by such forward-looking statements. A complete discussion of risks and uncertainties that may affect the accuracy of forward-looking statements included in this press release or which may otherwise affect Tower‚Äôs business is included under the heading ‚ÄúRisk Factors‚Äù in Tower‚Äôs most recent filings on Forms 20-F, F-3, F-4 and 6-K, as were filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the ‚ÄúSEC‚Äù) and the Israel Securities Authority. Tower does not intend to update, and expressly disclaim any obligation to update, the information contained in this release.

About LightIC
Founded in 2019, LightIC Technologies is a global leader in silicon photonics‚Äìbased FMCW LiDAR, with deep expertise in designing and integrating silicon photonic chips for scalable, high-performance sensing. The company develops highly integrated LiDAR-on-a-chip solutions powering next-generation automotive, robotics, and physical AI applications. LightIC is among the few companies worldwide to have successfully delivered low-SWaP-C FMCW LiDAR systems into real-world deployment.

news.Title: Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS) Could Become A Multi-Bagger
news.Content:
Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS) Could Become A Multi-Bagger

Simply Wall St
Mon, January 5, 2026 at 2:40 AM PST 2 min read

In this article: CRUS

If you're looking for a multi-bagger, there's a few things to keep an eye out for. One common approach is to try and find a company with returns on capital employed (ROCE) that are increasing, in conjunction with a growing amount of capital employed. This shows us that it's a compounding machine, able to continually reinvest its earnings back into the business and generate higher returns. Speaking of which, we noticed some great changes in Cirrus Logic's ( NASDAQ:CRUS ) returns on capital, so let's have a look.

Trump has pledged to "unleash" American oil and gas and these 15 US stocks have developments that are poised to benefit.
What Is Return On Capital Employed (ROCE)? Just to clarify if you're unsure, ROCE is a metric for evaluating how much pre-tax income (in percentage terms) a company earns on the capital invested in its business. The formula for this calculation on Cirrus Logic is:
Return on Capital Employed = Earnings Before Interest and Tax (EBIT) √∑ (Total Assets - Current Liabilities)
0.20 = US$449m √∑ (US$2.4b - US$210m) (Based on the trailing twelve months to September 2025) .
Therefore, Cirrus Logic has an ROCE of 20%. In absolute terms that's a great return and it's even better than the Semiconductor industry average of 8.9%.
View our latest analysis for Cirrus Logic
In the above chart we have measured Cirrus Logic's prior ROCE against its prior performance, but the future is arguably more important. If you're interested, you can view the analysts predictions in our free analyst report for Cirrus Logic .
So How Is Cirrus Logic's ROCE Trending? We like the trends that we're seeing from Cirrus Logic. The data shows that returns on capital have increased substantially over the last five years to 20%. The company is effectively making more money per dollar of capital used, and it's worth noting that the amount of capital has increased too, by 46%. So we're very much inspired by what we're seeing at Cirrus Logic thanks to its ability to profitably reinvest capital.

The Key Takeaway To sum it up, Cirrus Logic has proven it can reinvest in the business and generate higher returns on that capital employed, which is terrific. Considering the stock has delivered 31% to its stockholders over the last five years, it may be fair to think that investors aren't fully aware of the promising trends yet. So exploring more about this stock could uncover a good opportunity, if the valuation and other metrics stack up.
One more thing, we've spotted 1 warning sign facing Cirrus Logic that you might find interesting.

Story Continues
If you'd like to see other companies earning high returns, check out our free list of companies earning high returns with solid balance sheets here.

It does not constitute a recommendation to buy or sell any stock, and does not take account of your objectives, or your financial situation. We aim to bring you long-term focused analysis driven by fundamental data. Note that our analysis may not factor in the latest price-sensitive company announcements or qualitative material. Simply Wall St has no position in any stocks mentioned.

news.Title: The Zacks Analyst Blog Amazon, Palantir, TotalEnergies and MIND Technology
news.Content:
The Zacks Analyst Blog Amazon, Palantir, TotalEnergies and MIND Technology

Zacks Equity Research
Mon, January 5, 2026 at 2:14 AM PST 6 min read

In this article: PLTR

AMZN

MIND

TTE

For Immediate Releases Chicago, IL – January 5, 2026 – Zacks.com announces the list of stocks featured in the Analyst Blog. Every day the Zacks Equity Research analysts discuss the latest news and events impacting stocks and the financial markets. Stocks recently featured in the blog include Amazon.com, Inc. AMZN, Palantir Technologies Inc. PLTR, TotalEnergies SE TTE and MIND Technology, Inc. MIND.

Here are highlights from Monday’s Analyst Blog: Top Research Reports for Amazon, Palantir and TotalEnergies The Zacks Research Daily presents the best research output of our analyst team. Today's Research Daily features new research reports on 16 major stocks, including Amazon.com, Inc., Palantir Technologies Inc. and TotalEnergies SE, as well as a micro-cap stock MIND Technology, Inc.The Zacks microcap research is unique as our research content on these small and under-the-radar companies is the only research of its type in the country.

These research reports have been hand-picked from the roughly 70 reports published by our analyst team today.
You can see all of today’s research reports here >>>
Ahead of Wall Street The daily 'Ahead of Wall Street' article is a must-read for all investors who would like to be ready for that day's trading action. The article comes out before the market opens, attempting to make sense of that morning's economic releases and how they will affect that day's market action. You can read this article for free on our home page and can actually sign up there to get an email notification as this article comes out each morning.

You can read today's AWS here >>> Odds for a "January Effect" in 2026?
Today's Featured Research Reports Amazon.com’s shares have outperformed the Zacks Internet - Commerce industry over the past six months (+4.5% vs. +2.4%). The company’s international expansion and diversification across e-commerce, AWS cloud services, advertising, and streaming create multiple revenue streams while reducing concentration risk.

Management's Q4 2025 guidance projects net sales of $206-$213 billion with operating income between $21-$26 billion, reflecting operational efficiency gains. AI integration across operations enhances personalization, logistics and AWS offerings, strengthening competitive positioning. The Zacks analyst expect 2025 net sales to grow 10.6% from 2024.
However, substantial capital expenditure requirements for AI infrastructure and data centers strain financial resources and compress margins. The company's expanding debt burden reduces financial flexibility amid rising interest rates. Intensifying competition from Walmart, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud is an overhang.

Story Continues
(You can read the full research report on Amazon.com here >>> )
Shares of Palantir have outperformed the Zacks Internet - Software industry over the past six months (+32.3% vs. -6.5%). The company’s AI strategy, driven by Foundry, Gotham, and AIP platforms, targets government and commercial sectors, enabling real-time insights and operational efficiency. Notable defense projects, like Open DAGIR and AIP boot camps for commercial clients, boost customer acquisition.

With $5.4 billion in cash, no debt, and S&P 500 inclusion, Palantir enjoys strong liquidity, growing revenues, and increased investor visibility. Meanwhile, PLTR's reluctance to pay dividends is a green flag for dividend-seeking investors.
Intense competition from tech giants and rising costs amidst a rapidly evolving AI landscape and an elevated valuation challenge its appeal. Palantir shares have gained 122.5% in a year, and we have a neutral rating on it in anticipation of a correction.
(You can read the full research report on Palantir here >>> )
TotalEnergies’ shares have outperformed the Zacks Oil and Gas - Refining and Marketing industry over the past six months (+5.9% vs. +1.7%). The company is gaining from contributions coming from startups, acquired assets, well-spread LNG assets and upstream assets located in the new hydrocarbon-producing regions. Contributions from multi-energy assets spread across the globe boost its earnings.

TotalEnergies’ free cash flow allows it to increase shareholders’ value. Cost reduction initiatives will boost margins and the company aims to generate 15-20% of sales from low-carbon business by 2040. TotalEnergies is investing in clean power generation and lowering emissions.
Yet TotalEnergies operates multiple assets globally, and in some regions, production might be impacted due to security concerns. It remains exposed to acquisition-related risks as these assets contribute a sizable volume to production.
(You can read the full research report on TotalEnergies here >>> )
Shares of MIND Technology have gained +11.4% over the past six months against the Zacks Technology Services industry’s gain of +15.4%. This microcap company with a market capitalization of $79.44 million shows improving near-term visibility, with a $9.5 million seismic contract secured in December 2025, highlighting product demand. Recent expansion of its Huntsville facility supports higher-margin throughput and positions the firm for complex project growth.

New capital flexibility via a $25 million ATM offering and $4 million repurchase program enhances strategic agility. MIND benefits from exposure to a resilient global marine seismic market and operates a globally diversified footprint, aiding responsiveness and contract wins.
However, declining revenue and backlog highlight demand volatility, and a growing reliance on aftermarket sales may limit long-term upside. Profitability is pressured by modestly rising operating expenses. Despite this, shares are up 13.7% in the past year, and valuation remains attractive at 1.1X EV/Sales and 7.87X EV/EBITDA, well below peers.
(You can read the full research report on MIND Technology here >>> )
Why Haven't You Looked at Zacks' Top Stocks? Since 2000, our top stock-picking strategies have blown away the S&P's +7.7% average gain per year. Amazingly, they soared with average gains of +48.4%, +50.2% and +56.7% per year.
Today you can access their live picks without cost or obligation.
See Stocks Free >>

He is frequently quoted in the print and electronic media and publishes the weekly Earnings Trends and Earnings Preview reports. news.Title: Earnings Preview: What to Expect From NXP Semiconductors‚Äô Report
news.Content:
Earnings Preview: What to Expect From NXP Semiconductors‚Äô Report

Kritika Sarmah
Mon, January 5, 2026 at 1:37 AM PST 2 min read

In this article: NXPI

With a market cap of $55.7 billion, NXP Semiconductors N.V. (NXPI) is a leading global semiconductor company headquartered in the Netherlands. It specializes in embedded processing, secure connectivity, and analog solutions, securing a strong competitive position in automotive electronics, which is its largest revenue driver, supplying chips for vehicle networking, safety, infotainment, and software-defined vehicle architectures.

The company is slated to announce its fiscal Q4 2025 results soon. Ahead of this event, analysts expect NXP Semiconductors to report an EPS of $2.93, a 3.5% increase from $2.83 in the year-ago quarter. It has exceeded Wall Street's earnings expectations in three of the past four quarters while missing on another occasion.
More News from Barchart Tesla Stock Has Been Flat For 2 Months - How to Make a 3.2% Yield in One-Month Puts
CES 2026, Sector Rotation and Other Key Things to Watch this Week
Stocks Set to Open Higher as Investors Stay Calm Despite Venezuela Tumult, U.S. Jobs Data Awaited
Get exclusive insights with the FREE Barchart Brief newsletter. Subscribe now for quick, incisive midday market analysis you won't find anywhere else.
For fiscal 2025, analysts expect the chipmaker to report EPS of $10.22, marking an 11.4% drop from $11.54 in fiscal 2024. However, EPS is anticipated to grow 18.1% year-over-year to $12.07 in fiscal 2026.
Shares of NXP Semiconductors have surged 7.3% over the past 52 weeks, lagging behind the broader S&P 500 Index's ($SPX) 16.9% increase and the SPDR S&P Semiconductor ETF's (XSD) 33.1% surge over the same period.
On Dec. 19, Shares of NXP Semiconductors rose 2.6% in afternoon trading after Truist Securities analyst William Stein raised his price target on the stock to $265 from $254 while reaffirming a ‚ÄúBuy‚Äù rating, signaling increased confidence in the company‚Äôs valuation. The move was also supported by broader optimism across the semiconductor sector, driven by strong demand for artificial intelligence, data centers, and high-performance computing, which continues to underpin expectations of sustained industry growth.

Analysts' consensus view on NXPI stock remains bullish, with an overall "Strong Buy" rating. Out of 30 analysts covering the stock, 22 recommend a "Strong Buy," two "Moderate Buys," and six "Holds." The average analyst price target for NXP Semiconductors is $259.29, indicating a potential upside of 17.2% from the current levels.
On the date of publication, Kritika Sarmah did not have (either directly or indirectly) positions in any of the securities mentioned in this article. All information and data in this article is solely for informational purposes. This article was originally published on Barchart.com

news.Title: A Look At IREN (NasdaqGS:IREN) Valuation After Microsoft AI Deal And New Share Registration
news.Content:
A Look At IREN (NasdaqGS:IREN) Valuation After Microsoft AI Deal And New Share Registration

Simply Wall St
Mon, January 5, 2026 at 1:12 AM PST 3 min read

In this article: IREN

BTC-USD

MSFT

IREN (NasdaqGS:IREN) drew fresh attention after filing a US$660.975m shelf registration covering 17,500,000 ordinary shares tied to its 2025 Omnibus Incentive Plan, alongside progress on its US$9.7b Microsoft AI cloud contract.
See our latest analysis for IREN.
The 13.05% 1 day share price return to US$42.70 comes after a tough few months, with a 90 day share price return of a 30.77% decline. At the same time, the 1 year total shareholder return of 262.79% and the very large 3 year total shareholder return show how strongly sentiment has swung around this high beta mix of bitcoin mining and AI infrastructure, as investors weigh growth potential against dilution risk and higher short interest.

If IREN's AI and crypto mix has grabbed your attention, it could be a good moment to scan other high growth tech and AI names through high growth tech and AI stocks for fresh ideas.
With a 1 year total return above 260%, fresh short interest near 15% and a large Microsoft AI contract in play, you have to ask yourself: is IREN still mispriced, or is the market already baking in years of future growth?
Most Popular Narrative: 55% Undervalued According to BlackGoat, the narrative fair value of US$94.84 sits well above IREN's last close at US$42.70. This frames a sizable upside gap before you even factor in its Microsoft contract and AI expansion plans.
Read the complete narrative.
What earnings ramp justifies that gap? The narrative leans on rapid revenue expansion, rising profit margins and a premium future P/E usually reserved for high growth software names. Curious which assumptions really drive that US$94.84 figure and 55% discount call?
Result: Fair Value of $94.84 (UNDERVALUED)

Have a read of the narrative in full and understand what's behind the forecasts.
However, that upside story can break quickly if Bitcoin prices weaken, or if further equity raises and dilution blunt the impact of any future earnings ramp investors are expecting.
Find out about the key risks to this IREN narrative.

news.Title: Zacks Industry Outlook Highlights Apple, Dell and One Stop Systems
news.Content:
Zacks Industry Outlook Highlights Apple, Dell and One Stop Systems

Zacks Equity Research
Mon, January 5, 2026 at 1:12 AM PST 8 min read

In this article: AAPL

DELL

OSS

For Immediate Release Chicago, IL ‚Äì January 5, 2026 ‚Äì Today, Zacks Equity Research discusses Apple AAPL, Dell Technologies DELL and One Stop Systems OSS.
Industry: Micro-Computers
Link: https://www.zacks.com/commentary/2810915/3-stocks-to-watch-from-the-challenging-computer-industry
The Zacks Computer ‚Äì Micro Computers industry players are suffering from waning demand for consumer PCs. Heightened geopolitical challenges post-U.S. President Donald Trump‚Äôs decision to levy tariffs on trade partners are expected to hurt industry participants. Weak demand in China has been a headwind. However, industry participants like Apple , Dell Technologies and One Stop Systems are benefiting from steady demand for enterprise devices, including laptops, tablets and smartphones.

The improving availability of 5G-enabled smartphones has been a key catalyst for industry participants. The launch of foldable and artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning-infused smartphones, tablets, wearables, hearables and PCs is another major growth driver for industry participants.
Industry Description The Zacks Computer ‚Äì Micro Computers industry comprises companies that offer smartphones, desktops, laptops, printers, wearables and 3-D printers. Such devices are based on either iOS, MacOS, iPadOS, WatchOS, Microsoft Windows, or Google Chrome and Android operating systems. The companies predominantly use processors from Apple, Intel, AMD, Qualcomm, NVIDIA and Samsung.

Expanding screen size, better display and enhanced storage capabilities have been the key catalysts driving the rapid proliferation of smartphones. This has been well-supported by faster mobile processors. Laptops, both consumer and commercial, benefit from faster processors, sleek designs and expanded storage facilities. The addition of healthcare features has been driving the demand for wearables.
3 Micro Computer Industry Trends to Watch Enterprise Adoption Remains Healthy : Strong enterprise demand has been benefiting the industry participants. The growing adoption of a hybrid working environment bodes well for the players, as demand for laptops and tablets is expected to increase. Demand for smart devices that offer facial recognition, retina scans or finger impressions to verify the user for biometrics is gaining traction as enterprises enhance security.

Impressive Form Factor Drives Demand : Expanding screen size, better display and enhanced storage capabilities have been the key catalysts driving the rapid proliferation of smartphones and tablets. This has been well-supported by faster mobile processors from Qualcomm, NVIDIA, Apple and Samsung. Improved Internet penetration and speed, along with the evolution of mobile apps, have made smartphones indispensable for consumers. Improved graphics quality is making smartphones suitable for playing sophisticated games. This is driving the demand for high-end smartphones and opening up significant opportunities for device makers.

Story Continues
AI-enabled PCs to Boost Demand : Personal computers (desktops and laptops), be they Windows or Apple‚Äôs MacOS-based ones, are expected to benefit from AI infusion. The addition of neural processing units (NPUs), which are dedicated units to manage AI-related tasks, in PCs is a driving demand for AI-enabled devices. AMD, Qualcomm and Intel offer NPU chips with OEMs such as ASUS, Acer, Lenovo, Microsoft, HP and others building these AI-enabled devices. Canalys expects AI-capable PC shipments to make up 50% of PC shipments in 2026. This offers significant growth opportunities for industry participants.

Zacks Industry Rank Indicates Dull Prospect The Zacks Computer ‚Äì Micro Computers industry is housed within the broader Zacks Computer and Technology sector. It carries a Zacks Industry Rank #190, which places it in the bottom 22% of more than 250 Zacks industries.
The group‚Äôs Zacks Industry Rank, which is the average of the Zacks Rank of all the member stocks, indicates bearish near-term prospects. Our research shows that the top 50% of the Zacks-ranked industries outperform the bottom 50% by a factor of more than two to one.

The industry‚Äôs position in the bottom 50% of the Zacks-ranked industries is a result of a negative earnings outlook for the constituent companies in aggregate. Looking at the aggregate earnings estimate revisions, it appears that analysts are pessimistic about this group‚Äôs earnings growth potential. Since March 31, the Zacks Consensus Estimate for this industry‚Äôs 2026 earnings has moved south by 0.5%.
Given the dull outlook, there are only a few stocks worth watching in the industry. But before we present those stocks, let‚Äôs take a look at the industry‚Äôs recent stock-market performance and valuation picture.
Industry Lags Sector and S&P 500 The Zacks Computer ‚Äì Micro Computers industry has underperformed the broader Zacks Computer and Technology sector, as well as the S&P 500, over the past year.
The industry has returned 9% over this period compared with the S&P 500‚Äôs growth of 19.6% and the broader sector‚Äôs appreciation of 27.4%.

Industry's Current Valuation On the basis of forward 12-month P/E, which is a commonly used multiple for valuing computer stocks, we see that the industry is currently trading at 31.06X compared with the S&P 500‚Äôs 23.30X and the sector‚Äôs 29.55X.
Over the last five years, the industry has traded as high as 31.48X and as low as 26.24X, with the median being 27.69X.

3 Computer Stocks to Watch Right Now One Stop Systems : This Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) company offers specialized enterprise-class high-performance compute, high-speed switch fabrics and storage hardware and software. These are designed to target edge applications for AI and machine learning, sensor processing, sensor fusion and autonomy. You can see the complete list of today‚Äôs Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy) stocks here.

One Stop‚Äôs product pipeline is expanding across leading defense organizations and advanced commercial enterprises. The company is investing in next-generation product development and advancing new program opportunities that are expected to contribute to positive bookings growth in 2026 and 2027. Increase exposure on the P-8 Poseidon Reconnaissance aircraft program bodes well for OSS.
The Zacks Consensus Estimate for 2026 earnings has been steady at 8 cents per share over the past 30 days. The stock has appreciated 113.4% in a year.
Dell Technologies : This Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) company is benefiting from strong demand for AI servers, driven by ongoing digital transformation and heightened interest in generative AI applications. The growing demand for AI-enabled PCs is contributing to its Client Solutions Group‚Äôs (CSG) revenue growth.

Dell Technologies‚Äô ongoing PC refresh cycle has been noteworthy. The company‚Äôs leadership emphasized that the transition to Windows 11 is not yet finished. About 500 million PCs that can run Windows 11 are still waiting for upgrades.
The Zacks Consensus Estimate for fiscal 2026 earnings has been steady at $9.89 per share over the past 30 days. The stock has appreciated 11% in a year.
Apple : This Zacks Rank #3 company‚Äôs prospects ride on continued iPhone 16 series sales and strong iPhone 17 series adoption. Apple now expects the December quarter‚Äôs (first-quarter fiscal 2026) iPhone sales to grow in double digits year over year.
Services, which comprises Apple‚Äôs advertising business, AppleCare, Cloud Services, Digital content (Arcade, Music, Fitness+, TV, News+) and Payment services (Apple Card & Apple Pay), is riding on an expanding base of installed devices. Apple‚Äôs Services segment benefits from an expanding games portfolio and the growing popularity of Apple TV+. Apple‚Äôs strategy of adding new games on a continuous basis is driving its user base. Apple TV+ is benefiting from an expanding content portfolio.

The Zacks Consensus Estimate for fiscal 2025 earnings has increased 7 cents to $8.11 per share over the past 60 days. Apple shares have increased 9% in the trailing 12-month period.

news.Title: Lululemon, Tesla, Delta, Nike and More Stocks That Defined Last Week
news.Content:
Lululemon, Tesla, Delta, Nike and More Stocks That Defined Last Week

The Wall Street Journal
Mon, January 5, 2026 at 12:15 AM PST

In this article: LULU

TSLA

DAL

NKE

BYDDF

Why did precious metals lose their sheen? And how much did holiday snowstorms hit airline stocks? Plus, how is BYD shaking up the electric-vehicle race? Reporter Francesca Fontana discusses the biggest asset moves of last week and the news that drove them.

news.Title: A Look At Amazon (AMZN) Valuation As AI And Cloud Growth Renew Investor Interest
news.Content:
A Look At Amazon (AMZN) Valuation As AI And Cloud Growth Renew Investor Interest

Simply Wall St
Sun, January 4, 2026 at 10:10 PM PST 3 min read

In this article: AMZN

Recent commentary on Amazon.com (AMZN) is centering on a pickup in its core engines, with Amazon Web Services, AI heavy digital advertising, and more efficient e-commerce operations renewing interest in the stock.
See our latest analysis for Amazon.com.
Despite the latest 1 day and 7 day share price declines, Amazon.com‚Äôs current share price of US$226.50 sits against a three year total shareholder return of about 159%, with momentum recently softer as investors weigh AI driven growth news against valuation and insider selling headlines.

If AI, cloud and e commerce are on your radar, this could be a good moment to widen your watchlist with high growth tech and AI stocks for more potential ideas beyond Amazon.
With Amazon now at US$226.50, a 3 year total shareholder return near 159%, solid reported revenue and net income growth, and a flagged intrinsic discount of about 40%, key questions arise: is there still a buying opportunity here, or is the market already pricing in future growth?
Most Popular Narrative Narrative: 3.5% Undervalued According to Zwfis, the narrative fair value of US$234.75 sits slightly above Amazon.com's last close at US$226.50, framing the stock as modestly discounted in their view.
Read the complete narrative.
Curious how an 8% discount rate, double digit revenue growth and a rich future earnings multiple come together? The narrative stitches these into a single fair value roadmap that challenges the current price. Want to see which profit assumptions do the heavy lifting in that US$234.75 figure?

Result: Fair Value of $234.75 (UNDERVALUED)
Have a read of the narrative in full and understand what's behind the forecasts.
However, this storyline still depends on AWS growth holding up and on management turning heavy AI and infrastructure spending into profits rather than just higher costs.
Find out about the key risks to this Amazon.com narrative.
Another Angle On Value So far the focus has been on fair value estimates and narrative assumptions, but the current P/E of 31.7x adds a different twist. It sits well above the global multiline retail industry at 19.4x, yet slightly below peers at 33.4x and the fair ratio of 40.4x.
That mix points to a market that already prices in a premium business, but not all the way up to where the fair ratio suggests sentiment might change. This leaves investors weighing whether this premium looks more like valuation risk or potential room for a rerating.

Story Continues
See what the numbers say about this price ‚Äî find out in our valuation breakdown.
Build Your Own Amazon.com Narrative If you see the numbers differently, or just like testing your own assumptions, you can spin up a personalized Amazon.com view in minutes: Do it your way .
A great starting point for your Amazon.com research is our analysis highlighting 4 key rewards and 1 important warning sign that could impact your investment decision.

Looking for more investment ideas? If you are serious about building a stronger portfolio, do not stop at one stock. Use curated stock lists to quickly spot ideas that fit your approach.
Target potential mispricing by reviewing these 875 undervalued stocks based on cash flows that align with your view on cash flow and price.
Back your AI thesis with real tickers by scanning these 25 AI penny stocks that tie growth stories to actual business metrics.
Lock in potential income streams by checking these 14 dividend stocks with yields > 3% and see which payouts might suit your goals.

This article by Simply Wall St is general in nature. We provide commentary based on historical data and analyst forecasts only using an unbiased methodology and our articles are not intended to be financial advice. It does not constitute a recommendation to buy or sell any stock, and does not take account of your objectives, or your financial situation. We aim to bring you long-term focused analysis driven by fundamental data. Note that our analysis may not factor in the latest price-sensitive company announcements or qualitative material. Simply Wall St has no position in any stocks mentioned.
Companies discussed in this article include AMZN .
Have feedback on this article? Concerned about the content? Get in touch with us directly. Alternatively, email editorial-team@simplywallst.com

news.Title: TSMC Shares Jump Most Since April After Goldman Lifts Target 35%
news.Content:
TSMC Shares Jump Most Since April After Goldman Lifts Target 35%

Sangmi Cha
Sun, January 4, 2026 at 7:51 PM PST 2 min read

In this article: TSM

NVDA

AAPL

(Bloomberg) -- Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. shares climbed by the most since April, as the world‚Äôs largest contract chipmaker rides a continued wave of optimism over artificial intelligence demand into the new year.
Shares of the key supplier to Nvidia Corp. and Apple Inc. jumped as much as 6.9% to touch a new record high in Taipei. That came after Goldman Sachs Group Inc. raised its TSMC price target 35% to NT$2,330, citing expectations of another year of solid growth.

Most Read from Bloomberg
Sinkholes and Quake-Hit Roads Expose Japan‚Äôs Infrastructure Emergency
TSMC helped lead a broad charge in Asian tech stocks Monday as investors plow more cash into the AI theme despite concerns of overheating. The sector was once again the biggest boost to regional equities as fear of missing out on further gains overcame concerns of short-term volatility in the wake of US strikes against Venezuela.
‚ÄúWe view AI as a multi-year growth engine for TSMC,‚Äù Goldman analysts including Bruce Lu wrote in a report. Lu notes the company‚Äôs profit margins are improving, even as he projects it will spend $150 billion over the next three years to increase capacity.
Among other chip stocks, South Korea‚Äôs Samsung Electronics Co. extended gains to a fifth-straight session. The memory maker is expected to report preliminary results later this week that will provide further clues on the whether earnings justify the sector‚Äôs big gains.
TSMC shares surged 44% in 2025, pushing its market value above $1 trillion for the first time. That reflects increased investor confidence in its central position amid the AI boom, with many of the world‚Äôs chip companies relying on its foundry services.

‚ÄúFor leading-edge semiconductor, capacity from TSMC is the king,‚Äù Sanford C. Bernstein & Co. analysts including Mark Li wrote in a note dated Friday. This year ‚Äúis still all about AI,‚Äù though the analysts recommend investors ‚Äúfocus on quality‚Äù given worries of a bubble.
--With assistance from Cindy Wang.

news.Title: Ready to Buy Nvidia Stock? Check Out This Option.
news.Content:
Ready to Buy Nvidia Stock? Check Out This Option.

Lyle Daly, The Motley Fool
Sun, January 4, 2026 at 7:51 PM PST 3 min read

In this article: NVDA

Key Points Nvidia's financials continue to improve.
Its GPUs are in high demand from AI companies.
If you're unsure whether to load up on Nvidia stock now, another option is dollar-cost averaging -- putting smaller investments on auto-pilot.
10 stocks we like better than Nvidia ‚Ä∫
Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) just finished up another great year. The stock rose 39% in 2025 and looking at recent earnings reports, for the first three quarters of its 2026 fiscal year (the nine-month period ending Oct. 26, 2025), the chipmaker's revenue increased 62% year over year. Gross profit increased 48%, and net income increased 52%.
Expectations are high for this year, especially after management revealed an order backlog of $500 billion through the end of 2026. However, Nvidia is trading at an expensive 46 times trailing earnings. With that in mind, should you buy Nvidia stock now or wait for a cheaper opportunity?
How to buy Nvidia shares There's a lot to like about Nvidia as an investment. Nvidia's graphics processing units (GPUs) are in high demand from other AI companies, which is the primary reason its revenue has exploded. Data center revenue made up 90% of Nvidia's total revenue in its most recent quarter. It's certainly a quality company to have in your portfolio, particularly if you're looking for top AI stocks . Excellent companies often trade at high valuations, so you shouldn't let its price-to-earnings ratio (P/E) dissuade you from investing.

That said, it's normal to question how much more Nvidia can grow if there is a pullback in the near future. It's the largest public company by market cap as I write this, and the valuation is high, although reasonable compared to most AI companies. For perspective, competitor Advanced Micro Devices trades at 106 times trailing earnings, making Nvidia look like a bargain in comparison.
If you're concerned about investing too heavily in Nvidia all at once, dollar-cost averaging is a good alternative. This mans buying a fixed amount of Nvidia stock on a schedule that works for you. For example, you could purchase one or two shares each week no matter what the stock is doing.
I've dollar-cost averaged into many tech stocks I like, Nvidia included. It's a useful strategy for volatile stocks because even if the share price declines, you'll have the opportunity to buy the dip.

Should you buy stock in Nvidia right now? Before you buy stock in Nvidia, consider this:
The Motley Fool Stock Advisor analyst team just identified what they believe are the 10 best stocks for investors to buy now‚Ä¶ and Nvidia wasn‚Äôt one of them. The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years.

Story Continues
Consider when Netflix made this list on December 17, 2004... if you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation, you‚Äôd have $490,703 !* Or when Nvidia made this list on April 15, 2005... if you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation, you‚Äôd have $1,157,689 !*
Now, it‚Äôs worth noting Stock Advisor‚Äôs total average return is 966 % ‚Äî a market-crushing outperformance compared to 194% for the S&P 500. Don't miss the latest top 10 list, available with Stock Advisor , and join an investing community built by individual investors for individual investors.

Lyle Daly has positions in Nvidia. The Motley Fool has positions in and recommends Advanced Micro Devices and Nvidia. The Motley Fool has a disclosure policy .

ÈõªÂ≠êÊ∂àË≤ªÈ†òÂüüÂº∑Ë™ø„ÄåÊÉÖÂ¢ÉÂ∞éÂêë‚ÄßÊô∫ÊÖßÂª∂‰º∏„ÄçÔºå‰ª•ÂØ¶Èöõ‰ΩøÁî®ÊÉÖÂ¢ÉÁÇ∫Ê†∏ÂøÉÔºåÊ∑±ËÄïÈóúÈçµ‰ΩøÁî®ÊóèÁæ§Ôºå‰∏¶Â∞áÊ∞∏Á∫åÁ¥çÂÖ•Áî¢ÂìÅËàáÂ∏ÇÂ†¥Â∏ÉÂ±ÄÔºåÂ¶ÇËèØÁ¢©‰ª•ASUS AI Hub‰ΩàÂ±Ä‰ºÅÊ•≠AIÊúçÂãô„ÄÅÊäÄÂòâ(2376)ÈÄèÈÅéINDUSTRYÂπ≥Âè∞Ê∑±ËÄï‰ºÅÊ•≠Á¥öÊáâÁî®Â∏ÇÂ†¥„ÄÅÂ®ÅÂâõ(3260)Ââá‰ª•‰ºÅÊ•≠Á¥öSSDÊê∂ÊîªESGÈ©ÖÂãïÁöÑÊîøÂ∫úÊé°Ë≥ºÈúÄÊ±Ç„ÄÇ

ÈÅãÂãïÂÅ•Â∫∑È†òÂüüÂëàÁèæ„Äå‰ΩéÁ¢≥ÁîüÊ¥ª‚ÄßÊô∫ÊÖßÂçáÁ¥ö„ÄçË∂®Âã¢ÔºåÂ∞áÁ∂†Ëâ≤ÂÅ•Â∫∑ÁîüÊ¥ªÊñπÂºèËá™ÁÑ∂ËûçÂÖ•Êó•Â∏∏Ôºå‰∏¶ÈÄèÈÅéAIÊäÄË°ìÂçáÁ¥öÈÅãÂãïËàáÂÅ•Ë∫´È´îÈ©óÔºåÂåÖÊã¨ÁæéÂà©ÈÅî(9914)‰ª•Â§öÂÖÉE-BikeÂõûÊáâ‰∏çÂêåÊóèÁæ§ÈúÄÊ±Ç„ÄÅÂ∑®Â§ß(9921)Êì¥Â±ïÂÆ§ÂÖßÈ®é‰πòÂ∏ÉÂ±Ä„ÄÅÂñ¨Â±±(1736)ÁµêÂêàÈõ∂ÂîÆÈÄöË∑ØËàáAIÈáçË®ìË®≠ÂÇôÔºåÊ∑±ÂåñÊô∫ÊÖßÂÅ•Ë∫´È´îÈ©ó„ÄÇ

Â∑•Ê•≠Ë£ΩÈÄ†È†òÂüüËÅöÁÑ¶„ÄåÊï∏‰ΩçÊïàÁéá‚ÄßÁ∂†Ëâ≤ËΩâÂûã„ÄçÔºåÊèêÂçáËÉΩÊ∫êËàáË£ΩÈÄ†ÊïàÁéáÔºåÂåÖÊã¨‰∏≠Èºé(9933)ÊäïÂÖ•Â§©ÁÑ∂Ê∞£Âü∫Á§éÂª∫Ë®≠Â∑•Á®ã„ÄÅËá¥ËåÇÈõªÂ≠ê‰ª• AI ÂçîÂä©Ë®≠ÂÇôÊõ¥Âø´‰∏äÁ∑öÈÅã‰Ωú„ÄÅÊù±ÂÖÉÊèê‰æõËÉΩÊ∫êÁÆ°ÁêÜÊúçÂãôÔºåÂçîÂä©‰ºÅÊ•≠Èôç‰ΩéÁî®ÈõªËàáÁ¢≥ÊéíË≤†Êìî„ÄÇ

È£üÂìÅÈõ∂ÂîÆÈ†òÂüüËµ∞Âêë„Äå‰∏ñ‰ª£‰∫íÂãï‚ÄßÁîüÊ¥ªÂ†¥ÊôØ„ÄçÔºå‰ª•Âπ¥ËºïÊ∂àË≤ª‰∏ñ‰ª£ÁÇ∫Ê†∏ÂøÉÔºåÈÄèÈÅéË©±È°åÁî¢ÂìÅËàáÂØ¶È´îÁ©∫ÈñìÂâµÊñ∞ÔºåÊâìÈÄ†ËûçÂêàÁ§æ‰∫§„ÄÅÈ´îÈ©óËàáÈõ∂ÂîÆÁöÑÁîüÊ¥ªÂûãÊÖãÁ©∫ÈñìÔºåÂåÖÊã¨85Â∫¶C‰ª•Ë∑®ÊñáÂåñË©±È°åÈ£≤ÂìÅÊèêÂçáÂìÅÁâåÊ¥ªË∫çÂ∫¶„ÄÅÁµ±‰∏Ä‰ºÅÊ•≠(1216)ÊâìÈÄ†Êñ∞‰∏ñ‰ª£Ë§áÂêàÂïÜÂ†¥ÔºåÊãìÂ±ïÂ§öÂÖÉÁîüÊ¥ªÈ´îÈ©ó„ÄÇ

news.Title: Consumer Discretionary Stocks Q3 Teardown: Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) Vs The Rest
news.Content:
Consumer Discretionary Stocks Q3 Teardown: Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) Vs The Rest

Petr Hu≈ô≈•√°k
Sun, January 4, 2026 at 7:34 PM PST 3 min read

In this article: AAPL

As the Q3 earnings season wraps, let‚Äôs dig into this quarter‚Äôs best and worst performers in the consumer discretionary industry, including Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) and its peers.
This sector includes everything from cable TV services to hotel stays to gym memberships. While diverse, the way people buy and experience these products is being upended by the internet and digitization. Consumer discretionary companies are working to adapt to secular trends such as streaming video, online marketplaces for lodging accommodations, and connected fitness. That discretionary purchases are, by definition, something consumers can give up makes it even more imperative for companies in the space to adapt.

The 152 consumer discretionary stocks we track reported a satisfactory Q3. As a group, revenues were in line with analysts‚Äô consensus estimates while next quarter‚Äôs revenue guidance was 0.6% above.
In light of this news, share prices of the companies have held steady as they are up 2% on average since the latest earnings results.
Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) Creator of the iPhone and App Store, Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) is a legendary developer of consumer electronics and software.
Apple reported revenues of $102.5 billion, up 7.9% year on year. This print exceeded analysts‚Äô expectations by 0.8%. Overall, it was a strong quarter for the company with We were also happy its revenue narrowly outperformed Wall Street‚Äôs estimates, and the beat in Services was a bright spot.
The market was likely pricing in the results, and the stock is flat since reporting. It currently trades at $271.01.
We think Apple is a good business, but is it a buy today? Read our full report here, it‚Äôs free for active Edge members.
Best Q3: American Outdoor Brands (NASDAQ:AOUT) Spun off from Smith and Wesson in 2020, American Outdoor Brands (NASDAQ:AOUT) is an outdoor and recreational products company that offers outdoor and shooting sports products but does not sell firearms themselves.
American Outdoor Brands reported revenues of $57.2 million, down 5% year on year, outperforming analysts‚Äô expectations by 12.3%. The business had an incredible quarter with a beat of analysts‚Äô EPS and EBITDA estimates.
The market seems content with the results as the stock is up 2.6% since reporting. It currently trades at $7.92.
Is now the time to buy American Outdoor Brands? Access our full analysis of the earnings results here, it‚Äôs free for active Edge members .
Weakest Q3: PlayStudios (NASDAQ:MYPS) Founded by a team of former gaming industry executives, PlayStudios (NASDAQ:MYPS) offers free-to-play digital casino games.

Story continues
PlayStudios reported revenues of $57.65 million, down 19.1% year on year, falling short of analysts‚Äô expectations by 3%. It was a disappointing quarter as it posted a miss of analysts‚Äô daily active users estimates and a significant miss of analysts‚Äô adjusted operating income estimates.
As expected, the stock is down 26.6% since the results and currently trades at $0.67.

Read our full analysis of PlayStudios‚Äôs results here.
Funko (NASDAQ:FNKO) Boasting partnerships with media franchises like Marvel and One Piece, Funko (NASDAQ:FNKO) is a company specializing in creating and distributing licensed pop culture collectibles.
Funko reported revenues of $250.9 million, down 14.3% year on year. This print came in 4.2% below analysts' expectations. Zooming out, it was actually a very strong quarter as it recorded a beat of analysts‚Äô EPS and EBITDA estimates.

The stock is up 10.9% since reporting and currently trades at $3.35.
Read our full, actionable report on Funko here, it‚Äôs free for active Edge members.
Latham (NASDAQ:SWIM) Started as a family business, Latham (NASDAQ:SWIM) is a global designer and manufacturer of in-ground residential swimming pools and related products.
Latham reported revenues of $161.9 million, up 7.6% year on year. This result missed analysts‚Äô expectations by 1.8%. More broadly, it was a mixed quarter as it also recorded a solid beat of analysts‚Äô adjusted operating income estimates but a significant miss of analysts‚Äô EPS estimates.

The stock is down 12.1% since reporting and currently trades at $6.33.
Read our full, actionable report on Latham here, it‚Äôs free for active Edge members.

news.Title: Is Microsoft Attractively Priced After AI Partnerships and Cloud Expansion in 2026?
news.Content:
Is Microsoft Attractively Priced After AI Partnerships and Cloud Expansion in 2026?

Simply Wall St
Sun, January 4, 2026 at 7:08 PM PST 5 min read

In this article: MSFT

If you have ever wondered whether Microsoft is still a buy at today‚Äôs levels, you are not alone. This article is designed to cut through the noise and focus on what the stock is actually worth.
Despite a modest pullback of around 3.0% over the last week and a roughly flat start to the year, long term holders have still seen the share price climb about 12.5% over the last year and more than 115.3% over three years.
Recent headlines have focused on Microsoft‚Äôs continued push into artificial intelligence partnerships and cloud infrastructure, alongside regulatory scrutiny around big tech dominance globally. Together, these themes help explain why the market has been quick to reprice the stock whenever sentiment on growth or regulation shifts.
Right now, Microsoft scores a 4 out of 6 on our valuation checks . This suggests it may be undervalued on several fronts. We will walk through what that means using different valuation approaches, before ending with a more intuitive way to think about the company‚Äôs true worth.

Microsoft delivered 12.5% returns over the last year. See how this stacks up to the rest of the Software industry.
Approach 1: Microsoft Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) Analysis A Discounted Cash Flow model estimates what a company is worth by projecting the cash it can generate in the future and then discounting those cash flows back to today in $ terms.
For Microsoft, the latest twelve months Free Cash Flow is about $89.4 billion. Based on analyst forecasts and Simply Wall St‚Äôs extrapolations, free cash flow is projected to rise to roughly $369.8 billion by 2035, with intermediate steps such as around $206.2 billion by 2030. These projections assume robust growth over the next decade as Microsoft continues to scale its cloud and AI businesses.

Using a 2 Stage Free Cash Flow to Equity model, these future cash flows are discounted back to today to arrive at an estimated intrinsic value of about $604.22 per share. Compared to the current market price, this implies the stock is trading at roughly a 21.7% discount, suggesting the shares are materially undervalued based on cash flow potential.
Result: UNDERVALUED
Our Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis suggests Microsoft is undervalued by 21.7%. Track this in your watchlist or portfolio , or discover 875 more undervalued stocks based on cash flows .
Head to the Valuation section of our Company Report for more details on how we arrive at this Fair Value for Microsoft.
Approach 2: Microsoft Price vs Earnings For a highly profitable business like Microsoft, the price to earnings, or PE, ratio is a useful way to gauge whether the market price makes sense relative to the company‚Äôs current profit engine. Investors are generally willing to pay a higher PE for companies with stronger growth prospects and lower perceived risk, while slower growing or riskier firms usually trade on lower, more conservative multiples.

Story Continues
Microsoft currently trades on a PE of about 33.5x, which is slightly above the US Software industry average of roughly 31.7x and close to the peer group average of around 32.7x. To move beyond simple comparisons, Simply Wall St calculates a proprietary Fair Ratio: the PE multiple that would be reasonable given Microsoft‚Äôs earnings growth outlook, margins, size, industry and risk profile. This tailored Fair Ratio, at about 51.3x, better reflects the company‚Äôs specific strengths than a broad industry or peer average.
Comparing Microsoft‚Äôs actual PE of 33.5x to the Fair Ratio of 51.3x suggests the market is pricing the shares below what would be expected for a business of this quality and growth profile.
Result: UNDERVALUED
PE ratios tell one story, but what if the real opportunity lies elsewhere? Discover 1464 companies where insiders are betting big on explosive growth .
Upgrade Your Decision Making: Choose your Microsoft Narrative Earlier we mentioned that there is an even better way to understand valuation, so let us introduce you to Narratives. This is a simple framework where you attach a clear story about Microsoft‚Äôs future to concrete numbers like fair value, revenue growth, earnings and margins, and then see how that story stacks up against today‚Äôs share price.

A Narrative on Simply Wall St links three things together: the business story you believe, the financial forecast that follows from that story, and the resulting fair value estimate. All of this is presented in an accessible tool on the Community page that millions of investors already use.
Once you choose or create a Narrative, the platform continuously compares its fair value to Microsoft‚Äôs live market price to help you decide whether it looks more like a buy, hold or sell, and automatically updates that view when important news, earnings or guidance changes come in.
For example, one Microsoft Narrative on the Community page currently assumes a cautious outlook with fair value closer to about $360 per share, while another assumes robust AI led growth and pegs fair value above $620. This illustrates how two investors can look at the same company, plug in different expectations, and reach very different yet clearly explained conclusions.

For Microsoft, however, we will make it really easy for you with previews of two leading Microsoft Narratives:
üêÇ Microsoft Bull Case
Fair value: $624.45 per share
Implied undervaluation vs current price: approximately 24.2%
Forecast revenue growth: 15.30%
Assumes AI partnerships and Azure expansion sustain double digit revenue growth and support a durable, high margin cloud and subscription model.
Sees cybersecurity, Microsoft 365 and other recurring subscription revenues driving predictable earnings and free cash flow.
Accepts elevated AI and data center capex as justified by long term demand, with efficiency gains expected to keep margins broadly stable.
üêª Microsoft Bear Case
Fair value: $420.00 per share
Implied overvaluation vs current price: approximately 12.7%

Forecast revenue growth: -0.78%
Argues that massive AI and data center capex risks turning Microsoft into a lower return, capital intensive utility if AI pricing and demand disappoint.
Highlights pressure from a shrinking PC market, weak Xbox hardware performance, and deteriorating Windows user experience as structural headwinds.
Warns that AI tools like Copilot may cannibalize per seat Office revenues while partnership dependence and intensifying competition erode Microsoft‚Äôs moat.
Do you think there's more to the story for Microsoft? Head over to our Community to see what others are saying!
This article by Simply Wall St is general in nature. We provide commentary based on historical data and analyst forecasts only using an unbiased methodology and our articles are not intended to be financial advice. It does not constitute a recommendation to buy or sell any stock, and does not take account of your objectives, or your financial situation. We aim to bring you long-term focused analysis driven by fundamental data. Note that our analysis may not factor in the latest price-sensitive company announcements or qualitative material. Simply Wall St has no position in any stocks mentioned.
Companies discussed in this article include MSFT .

news.Content:
„ÄêÊôÇÂ†±-Âè∞ÂåóÈõª„ÄëÁî±Âè∞ÁÅ£Á∂ìÊøüÁ†îÁ©∂Èô¢‰∏ªËæ¶„ÄÅÂßîË®óÂúãÈöõÂìÅÁâåÂÉπÂÄºË™øÊü•Ê©üÊßãInterbrandÈÄ≤Ë°åÈëëÂÉπÁöÑ„Äå2025Âè∞ÁÅ£ÊúÄ‰Ω≥ÂúãÈöõÂìÅÁâåÂÉπÂÄº„ÄçÊ¶úÂñÆ‰ªäÔºà5ÔºâÊó•ÂÖ¨Â∏ÉÔºå‰ªäÂπ¥Ââç5Âêç‰æùÂ∫èÁÇ∫ËèØÁ¢©„ÄÅË∂®Âã¢ÁßëÊäÄ„ÄÅËÅØÁôºÁßë„ÄÅÁ†îËèØ„ÄÅÂè∞ÈÅîÈõªÂ≠ê„ÄÇË™øÊü•È°ØÁ§∫Ôºå2025Âπ¥Âè∞ÁÅ£Ââç25Â§ßÂúãÈöõÂìÅÁâåÁ∏ΩÂÉπÂÄºÈÅî151.49ÂÑÑÁæéÂÖÉÔºåÂπ¥Â¢û2.7%Ôºå‰∏çÂÉÖÈÄ£Á∫åÁ¨¨ÂÖ≠Âπ¥Á∂≠ÊåÅÂú®ÁôæÂÑÑÁæéÂÖÉ‰ª•‰∏äÊ∞¥Ê∫ñÔºå‰πüÂâµ‰∏ãÊ≠∑Âπ¥Êñ∞È´ò„ÄÇ

ÁßëÊäÄÁî¢Ê•≠‰ªçÊòØÊ¶úÂñÆ‰∏≠ÁöÑÊ†∏ÂøÉÂãïËÉΩ„ÄÇËèØÁ¢©ÊÜëËóâAIÈ©ÖÂãïÁ≠ñÁï•ÔºåÊï¥ÂêàÈõ≤Á´ØËàáÈÇäÁ∑£ÈÅãÁÆóÂ∏ÉÂ±ÄÔºåÁ¨¨ÂçÅ‰∫åÂ∫¶Áôª‰∏äÊ¶úÈ¶ñÔºõËÅØÁôºÁßëÊäÄÊåÅÁ∫åÂº∑ÂåñAIËàáÈÄöË®äÊäÄË°ìÁöÑÊï¥È´îÂ∏ÉÂ±ÄÔºåÂìÅÁâåÂÉπÂÄºÂπ¥Â¢ûÂπÖÈÅî45%ÔºåÁÇ∫‰ªäÂπ¥ÊàêÈï∑ÂπÖÂ∫¶ÊúÄÈ´òÁöÑÂìÅÁâå„ÄÇ

Êñ∞ÈÄ≤Ê¶úÂìÅÁâåÊñπÈù¢ÔºåËá¥ËåÇÈõªÂ≠êÈÄèÈÅéÂìÅÁâåÈáçÂ°ëËàáAI„ÄÅÂÖàÈÄ≤Ê∏¨Ë©¶ÊáâÁî®ÁöÑÊï¥ÂêàÔºåÈ¶ñÂ∫¶ÈÄ≤ÂÖ•Ââç25Â§ßÔºõÊù±ÂÖÉÈõªÊ©üÂâá‰ª•ËÉΩÊ∫êÊï¥ÂêàÊúçÂãôÁÇ∫‰∏ªËª∏ÔºåÁµêÂêàÈõªÊ∞£ÂåñËàáÁ∂†Ëâ≤ËÉΩÊ∫êÂ∏ÉÂ±ÄÔºåÊàêÂäüË∫çÂçáÊ¶úÂñÆ„ÄÇ

‰æùÁî¢Ê•≠Âà•ËßÄÂØüÔºåÁßëÊäÄËàáÈõªÂ≠êÊ∂àË≤ªÂìÅÁâåËÅöÁÑ¶AIÊáâÁî®ËàáÊÉÖÂ¢ÉÂåñÊúçÂãôÔºåÈÅãÂãïÂÅ•Â∫∑Áî¢Ê•≠ÁµêÂêà‰ΩéÁ¢≥ÁîüÊ¥ªËàáÊô∫ÊÖßÂåñÈ´îÈ©óÔºåÂ∑•Ê•≠Ë£ΩÈÄ†ÂâáËëóÈáçÊèêÂçáËÉΩÊ∫êÊïàÁéáËàáÊï∏‰ΩçÂåñÁÆ°ÁêÜÔºõÈ£üÂìÅÈõ∂ÂîÆËàáÈáëËûçÊúçÂãôÊ•≠ËÄÖÔºåÂâáÈÄèÈÅéË∑®‰∏ñ‰ª£‰∫íÂãï„ÄÅÊô∫ÊÖßÊúçÂãôËàáÊ∞∏Á∫åÈáëËûçÔºåÊì¥Â§ßÂìÅÁâåÂΩ±ÈüøÂäõ„ÄÇ

Êú¨Âπ¥Â∫¶Ê¶úÂñÆÈô§Ââç25Â§ßÂìÅÁâåÂ§ñÔºå‰πüÂêåÊ≠•ÂÖ¨Â∏É„ÄåÊΩõÂäõ‰πãÊòü„ÄçÂêçÂñÆÔºåÊ∂µËìã‰∏äÈäÄÁßëÊäÄ„ÄÅÂêàÂã§ÈõÜÂúò„ÄÅÂÆáÁûªÁßëÊäÄ„ÄÅÂÆèÊ≠£Ëá™ÂãïÁßëÊäÄ„ÄÅÂÆúÈºéÂúãÈöõ„ÄÅÁ†îÊèöÁßëÊäÄ„ÄÅÊ°ÇÁõüÂúãÈöõ„ÄÅÊåØÊ®∫ÈõªÂ≠ê„ÄÅÊô∂ÁùøÈÄöË®ä„ÄÅÁ®ãÊ≥∞Ê©üÊ¢∞„ÄÅÂã§Ë™†ËààÊ•≠„ÄÅÁ¢©Â§©ÁßëÊäÄËàáÈºéÁø∞ÁßëÊäÄÁ≠âÂìÅÁâåÔºåÈ°ØÁ§∫Âè∞ÁÅ£Áî¢Ê•≠Âú®Â§öÂÖÉÈ†òÂüüÊåÅÁ∫åÁ¥ØÁ©çÂìÅÁâåËÉΩÈáè„ÄÇ

InterbrandÊåáÂá∫ÔºåÊú™‰æÜÂè∞ÁÅ£ÂìÅÁâåÈ†àÈóúÊ≥®‰∏âÂ§ßÊñπÂêëÔºåÂåÖÊã¨Â∞áAIÁ¥çÂÖ•ÂìÅÁâåÊ†∏ÂøÉÂÆö‰Ωç„ÄÅÂº∑ÂåñÂ§öÂìÅÁâåÊû∂ÊßãÁÆ°ÁêÜÔºå‰ª•ÂèäÊï¥ÂêàÂÖßÂ§ñÈÉ®Ë≥áÊ∫ê‰ª•ÊâìÈÄ†‰∏ÄËá¥‰∏îÂèØÊåÅÁ∫åÁöÑÂìÅÁâåÈ´îÈ©ó„ÄÇÂú®AIÊäÄË°ìÂø´ÈÄüÊºîÈÄ≤ÁöÑÁí∞Â¢É‰∏ãÔºåÈï∑ÊúüÂìÅÁâåÁ∂ìÁáüËàá‰ª•‰∫∫ÁÇ∫Êú¨ÁöÑÂÉπÂÄºÊ∑±ÂåñÔºåÂ∞áÊàêÁÇ∫Âè∞ÁÅ£ÂìÅÁâåÊãìÂ±ïÂúãÈöõÂΩ±ÈüøÂäõÁöÑÈóúÈçµ„ÄÇÔºàÊñ∞ËÅû‰æÜÊ∫êÔºö‰∏≠ÊôÇÊñ∞ËÅûÁ∂≤ ÈÑ≠ÊÄùÊ•†Ôºâ

news.Title: Exclusive-Samsung to double mobile devices powered by Google's Gemini to 800 million units this year
news.Content:
Exclusive-Samsung to double mobile devices powered by Google's Gemini to 800 million units this year

Reuters
Sun, January 4, 2026 at 7:03 PM PST 3 min read

In this article: SSNLF

GOOG

AAPL

OPAI.PVT

SEOUL, Jan 5 (Reuters) - Samsung Electronics plans to double this year the number of its mobile devices with AI features powered by Google's Gemini, its co-CEO said, which would give the U.S. firm an edge over rivals as the global race in artificial ‚Äãintelligence hots up.
The South Korean company, which had rolled out Gemini-backed AI features to about 400 million mobile products, including smartphones and tablets, ‚Äåby last year, plans to boost that figure to 800 million in 2026.

"We will apply AI to all products, all functions, and all services as quickly as possible," T M Roh ‚Äåtold Reuters in his first interview since becoming Samsung Electronics co-CEO in November.
The plan by the world's largest backer of Google's Android mobile platform is set to give a major boost to its developer Google, which is locked in a race with OpenAI and others to attract more consumer users to their AI model.
Samsung seeks to reclaim its lost crown from Apple in the smartphone market and fend off competition from Chinese rivals not only in mobile telephones, but televisions and home ‚Å†appliances, all overseen by Roh.
It will offer integrated AI ‚Äåservices across consumer products to widen its lead over Apple in such features, though the latter was set be the top smartphone maker last year, according to market researcher Counterpoint.

AI RACE
Alphabet's Google launched the latest version of Gemini in November, ‚Äçhighlighting Gemini 3's lead on several popular industry measures of AI model performance.
In response to Gemini 3, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman reportedly issued an internal "code red," pausing non-core projects and redirecting teams to accelerate development. The ChatGPT maker launched its GPT-5.2 AI model a few weeks later.
Roh expects the adoption of AI to accelerate, as Samsung's surveys on ‚Äãawareness of its Galaxy AI brand jumped to a level of 80% from about 30% in just one year.
"Even though the AI technology might ‚Äåseem a bit doubtful right now, within six months to a year, these technologies will become more widespread," he said.
While search is the most used AI feature on phones, consumers also frequently use a range of generative AI editing and productivity tools for images and others, as well as translation and summary features, he said.

"NOT IMMUNE" TO MEMORY CHIP SHORTAGE
A global shortage of memory chips is a boon to Samsung's mainstay semiconductor business, but pressures margins on the smartphone business, its second largest revenue source.
"As this situation is unprecedented, no company is immune to its impact," Roh said, adding that the crisis affects not ‚Å†only mobile phones but other consumer electronics, from TVs to home appliances.

Story Continues
He did not rule ‚Äãout raising product prices, saying some impact was "inevitable" from a surge in memory chip prices, ‚Äãbut Samsung, the world‚Äôs No.1 TV maker, is working with partners on longer term strategies to minimise the impact.
Market researchers such as IDC and Counterpoint predict the global smartphone market will shrink next year, as the memory chip shortage threatens to drive ‚Äçup phone prices.

Roh said the market for ‚Å†foldable phones that Samsung pioneered in 2019 has been growing slower than expected.
He attributed this to the engineering complexities and lack of applications suitable for the hardware design, but expected the segment to go mainstream in the next two or three years.
A "very high" rate of foldable phone ‚Å†users opt for the same segment for their next purchase, he said, but gave no details.
Samsung controlled nearly two-thirds of the foldable smartphone market in the third quarter of 2025, according ‚Äåto Counterpoint.
But it faces competition from Chinese companies such as Huawei, as well as Apple, expected to launch its first foldable ‚Äåphone this year.
(Reporting by Hyunjoo Jin; Editing by Miyoung Kim and Clarence Fernandez)

news.Title: This Amazon Competitor Is Starting To Flare Up Following A Muted 2025: Momentum Score Surges
news.Content:
This Amazon Competitor Is Starting To Flare Up Following A Muted 2025: Momentum Score Surges

Vishaal Sanjay
Sun, January 4, 2026 at 4:31 PM PST 2 min read

In this article: AMZN

ETSY

GOOG

META

Amazon.com Inc. (NASDAQ: AMZN ) rival Etsy Inc. (NYSE: ETSY ) is beginning to stir after being dormant for an extended period of time, and this is already showing up in its Momentum score.
Shares of the vintage e-commerce website were up just 4.39% last year, and have largely lagged against peers and benchmarks over the past couple of years. It, however, looks set to start the new year with some fresh momentum.

Don't Miss:
The AI Marketing Platform Backed by Insiders from Google, Meta, and Amazon ‚Äî Invest at $0.85/Share
Missed Tesla? EnergyX Is Tackling the Next $200 Billion Opportunity ‚Äî Lithium
Amazon Rival Sees Spike In Momentum The Momentum score in Benzinga‚Äôs Edge Stock Rankings assesses the strength of a stock, taking into consideration its price movements and volatility across multiple time frames, before being ranked as a percentile against others.
Etsy‚Äôs Momentum score has surged from 32.82 to 47.16 within the span of a week, as the stock sits firmly within its 52-week range, while continuing to trend upward, hinting at a period of consolidation or indecision in the market, following an extended period of modest returns.

See Also: 7 Million Gamers Already Trust Gameflip With Their Digital Assets ‚Äî Now You Can Own a Stake in the Platform
The stock also gained momentum after the company announced a fresh $750 million share repurchase program last month, which is in addition to $200 million in pending authorizations.
Shares of Etsy were up 0.14% on Wednesday, closing at $55.44, and are up 0.69% overnight. The stock does fairly well on Momentum in Benzinga‚Äôs Edge Stock Rankings, with an unfavorable price trend in the short, medium and long terms. news.Title: Qualcomm (QCOM) Valuation Check as CES 2026 AI and Snapdragon X-Series Momentum Build
news.Content:
Qualcomm (QCOM) Valuation Check as CES 2026 AI and Snapdragon X-Series Momentum Build

Simply Wall St
Sun, January 4, 2026 at 4:14 PM PST 3 min read

In this article: QCOM

Qualcomm (QCOM) is stepping into CES 2026 with a spotlight on AI, new chips, and smarter devices, and that showcase is exactly why investors are reassessing what the current share price really implies.
See our latest analysis for QUALCOMM.
Those CES headlines are landing at a time when QUALCOMM‚Äôs 90 day share price return of 2.59 percent and 1 year total shareholder return of 12.05 percent signal steady, if not explosive, momentum behind the AI and on device story.

If Qualcomm‚Äôs AI push has your attention, it is also a good moment to explore other potential winners in high growth tech and AI stocks and see how they stack up on growth and execution.
With shares up more than 60 percent over three years and now sitting roughly 12 percent below the average analyst target, the real debate is simple: is Qualcomm still mispriced, or are investors already paying up for tomorrow‚Äôs AI growth?
Most Popular Narrative Narrative: 9.8% Undervalued With QUALCOMM closing at $172.98 versus an implied fair value of about $191.80, the most followed narrative sees room for further upside if execution holds.
Rapid growth in automotive and industrial IoT segments, supported by strong design win momentum and a robust multi year pipeline (with a combined $22 billion revenue target by 2029), is set to diversify Qualcomm's revenue base and drive margin accretive growth as these businesses become a larger share of total earnings.

Read the complete narrative.
Want to see what powers that optimism? The narrative leans on measured revenue growth, resilient margins, and a future earnings multiple below many high flying chip names.
Result: Fair Value of $191.8 (UNDERVALUED)
Have a read of the narrative in full and understand what's behind the forecasts.
However, sustained smartphone weakness or setbacks in Qualcomm‚Äôs AI and data center push could quickly challenge the upside implied in that 9.8 percent undervaluation.
Find out about the key risks to this QUALCOMM narrative.
Another View: DCF Says the Stock Is Rich While the narrative based fair value points to upside, our DCF model paints a cooler picture. Qualcomm is trading around $172.98 versus an estimated fair value near $165.41. This suggests the shares are slightly overvalued and raises the question: which story should investors trust?
Look into how the SWS DCF model arrives at its fair value.
Simply Wall St performs a discounted cash flow (DCF) on every stock in the world every day ( check out QUALCOMM for example ). We show the entire calculation in full. You can track the result in your watchlist or portfolio and be alerted when this changes, or use our stock screener to discover 875 undervalued stocks based on their cash flows . If you save a screener we even alert you when new companies match - so you never miss a potential opportunity.

Story Continues

A great starting point for your QUALCOMM research is our analysis highlighting 3 key rewards and 1 important warning sign that could impact your investment decision.

news.Title: Tesla (TSLA) Valuation Check After Recent Share Price Drift
news.Content:
Tesla (TSLA) Valuation Check After Recent Share Price Drift

Simply Wall St
Sun, January 4, 2026 at 4:13 PM PST 2 min read

In this article: TSLA

Why Tesla Stock Just Moved Tesla (TSLA) has been drifting lower over the past week, and that slide is starting to test investors patience as they weigh a strong multiyear track record against short-term pressure.
See our latest analysis for Tesla.
That recent 7 day share price decline comes after a choppy few months in which upbeat delivery data and ongoing autonomy headlines kept expectations elevated. A 1 year total shareholder return of 6.7% shows momentum has cooled but not reversed.

If Tesla volatility has you reassessing the space, it could be worth exploring other auto leaders and emerging players via our curated screener of auto manufacturers .
With profits still expanding and shares now trading below the average analyst target, investors face a key question: Is Tesla quietly slipping into undervalued territory, or is the market already baking in years of future growth?
Most Popular Narrative Narrative: 3% Overvalued According to BlackGoat, Tesla's fair value of $425.37 sits slightly below the recent $438.07 close, framing the stock as modestly ahead of that narrative price.
Read the complete narrative.
Curious how this vision translates into numbers? The narrative leans on rapid revenue expansion, rising margins, and a richer future earnings multiple. Want to see the exact assumptions driving that multi trillion dollar outcome and upgraded fair value path? Dive in and unpack the full thesis behind this price.

Result: Fair Value of $425.37 (OVERVALUED)
Have a read of the narrative in full and understand what's behind the forecasts.
However, the thesis leans heavily on timely FSD approvals and sustained Tesla brand strength, both of which are vulnerable to regulatory setbacks and intensifying Chinese competition.

„ÄêÊôÇÂ†±-Âè∞ÂåóÈõª„ÄëÂè∞ËÇ°2026Âπ¥Á¨¨‰∏ÄÂÄã‰∫§ÊòìÊó•Â§öÈ†≠Ê∞£Âã¢Âº∑ÂãÅÔºåÂè∞Á©çÈõªÔºà2330Ôºâ2Êó•Êº≤35ÂÖÉÊàñ2.26ÔºÖÔºåÊî∂1,585ÂÖÉÔºåÂÜçÂâµÈ´òÔºåÊåÅÁ∫åÊâÆÊºîÊíêÁõ§Ë¶ÅËßíÔºåÂêåÊôÇÔºåË®òÊÜ∂È´îÁöÑËèØÈÇ¶Èõª„ÄÅÂçó‰∫ûÁßëËÇ°ÂÉπ‰πüË°®Áèæ‰∫ÆÁúºÔºåÊøÄÂãµÂä†Ê¨äÊåáÊï∏ÁµÇÂ†¥Â§ßÊº≤1.33ÔºÖÊî∂Âú®29,349ÈªûÂâµÊ≠∑Âè≤Êñ∞È´òÂÉπÔºåÂè∞ËÇ°ETFÊº≤ÂπÖÂâçÂçÅÂº∑Êõ¥ÊòØÁπ≥Âá∫3.38ÔºÖÔΩû1.92ÔºÖÁöÑÂÑ™ÊñºÂ§ßÁõ§Ë°®ÁèæÔºåÂÖ∂‰∏≠Âèà‰ª•ÈéñÂÆöÂçäÂ∞éÈ´îÁ∏æÂÑ™ËÇ°ÁöÑICË®≠Ë®àÊóèÁæ§Á≠âË¢´ÂãïÂºèETFË°®ÁèæÊúÄÁÇ∫Âº∑ÂãÅ„ÄÇ

Ê†πÊìöÁµ±Ë®àÔºå2Êó•ÂñÆÊó•Êº≤ÂπÖÂâç‰∏âÂº∑ÁÇ∫Âè∞Êñ∞Ëá∫ÁÅ£ICË®≠Ë®àÔºà00947Ôºâ„ÄÅÊñ∞ÂÖâËá∫ÁÅ£ÂçäÂ∞éÈ´î30Ôºà00904ÔºâÂèäÂúãÊ≥∞Âè∞ÁÅ£ÁßëÊäÄÈæçÈ†≠Ôºà00881ÔºâÔºå3Ê™îETFÂêåÊôÇÂâµ‰∏ãÊéõÁâå‰æÜÁöÑÊ≠∑Âè≤Êñ∞È´òÂÉπ„ÄÇ

00947Âè∞Êñ∞Ëá∫ÁÅ£ICË®≠Ë®àÊàêÂàÜËÇ°Èô§ÂõäÊã¨ËÇ°Áéã‰ø°È©äÁ≠âICË®≠Ë®àÂÄãËÇ°Â§ñÔºåÊåáÊï∏Á∑®Ë£Ω‰πüËàáÊôÇ‰ø±ÈÄ≤ÔºåÂ∞áË®òÊÜ∂È´îICË®≠Ë®àÁ≠âÁõ∏ÈóúÁ¥∞ÂàÜÁî¢Ê•≠Á¥çÂÖ•ÊåáÊï∏Êé°Ê®£ÁØÑÂúçÔºåÂâçÂÖ´Â§ßÊàêÂàÜËÇ°Ê¨äÈáçÁöÜÈÄæ7ÔºÖÔºå‰∫¶ÂåÖÊã¨ËÅØÁôºÁßëÔºà2454Ôºâ„ÄÅËèØÈÇ¶ÈõªÔºà2344Ôºâ„ÄÅÁæ§ËÅØÔºà8299Ôºâ„ÄÅÂçó‰∫ûÁßëÔºà2408Ôºâ„ÄÅÂè∞ÈÅîÈõªÔºà2308Ôºâ„ÄÅ‰ø°È©äÔºà5274ÔºâÂèäÂâµÊÑèÔºà3443ÔºâÔºåÂèóÊÉ†Âè∞ÁÅ£ÁöÑICË®≠Ë®àÁî¢Ê•≠ËôïÊñºAIÁôºÂ±ïÁöÑÈóúÈçµÊ†∏ÂøÉÔºåËøëÊúüÁî¢Ê•≠ËΩâË∂®ÁÜ±Áµ°Ôºå‰ª•ÂèäË®òÊÜ∂È´îÂ§ßÊº≤ÁöÑË≤¢ÁçªÔºåÊåÅÁ∫åÊé®ÂçáËÇ°ÂÉπÂâµ‰∏ãÊ≠∑Âè≤Êñ∞È´ò„ÄÇ

00904Êñ∞ÂÖâËá∫ÁÅ£ÂçäÂ∞éÈ´î30Á∂ìÁêÜ‰∫∫Ë©π‰Ω≥?Ë°®Á§∫ÔºåÂè∞Á©çÈõª1Êúà15Êó•Ê≥ïË™™ÊúÉÂç≥Â∞áÂè¨ÈñãÔºåÊ†πÊìöÈÅéÂéª5Âπ¥Áµ±Ë®àÔºåÂè∞Á©çÈõª1ÊúàÂπ≥ÂùáËÇ°ÂÉπÊº≤ÂπÖ‰ªãÊñº3.4ÔºÖÂà∞11.5ÔºÖ‰∏çÁ≠âÔºå‰∏îÊØèÂπ¥Á∂≠ÊåÅÊ≠£Â†±ÈÖ¨Á¥ÄÈåÑÔºå1ÊúàÂè∞Á©çÈõªËÇ°ÂÉπ‰∏äÊº≤ÁöÑÂãùÁéáÈ´òÔºåÂê∏Âºï‰∏çÂ∞ëË≥áÈáëÊê∂Âú®Ê≥ïË™™ÊúÉÂâçÔºåÈñãÂßãÊèêÂâçÂ∏ÉÂ±ÄÂè∞Á©çÈõªÁ≠âÁõ∏Èóú‰æõÊáâÈèà„ÄÇ

Â∞§ÂÖ∂ÊòØÂ§ñË≥áÊ≥ï‰∫∫È†ê‰º∞Ôºå2026Âπ¥Âè∞Á©çÈõªÁöÑË≥áÊú¨ÊîØÂá∫ÈáëÈ°çÔºåÊúâÊúõËºÉ2025Âπ¥ÊèêÂçáÔºå‰∏îÈáëÈ°ç‰º∞480ÔΩû500ÂÑÑÂÖÉÔºå‰∏ªË¶Å7Ëá≥8ÊàêÊäïÂÖ•ÂÖàÈÄ≤Ë£ΩÁ®ãÁî¢ËÉΩÊì¥ÂÖÖ„ÄÅÂè¶Â§ñ2Âà∞3ÊàêÁ∂≠ÊåÅÂú®CoWoSÊäÄË°ìÂçáÁ¥öËàáÂÖ®ÁêÉÂª∫Âª†ÔºåÊï¥È´îÂü∫Êú¨Èù¢Â±ïÊúõÂÅèÂêëÊ≠£Èù¢„ÄÇ

2026Âπ¥1Êúà2Êó•ÈñãÁõ§ÁöÑÊ∞£Âã¢Âá∫Ëà™ÔºåÈ°ØÁ§∫Âè∞ËÇ°Â§öÈ†≠Êû∂ÊßãÊ•µÁÇ∫Á©©Âõ∫Ôºå‰∏äÊ™îÁÑ°Â£ìÔºåÊåÅÁ∫åÁúãÂ•ΩÂè∞Á©çÊ≥ïË™™Ê¶ÇÂøµ„ÄÅÊùêÊñôÂçáÁ¥öÊàñÁü≠Áº∫Ê¶ÇÂøµ„ÄÅÈ´òÈÄüÂÇ≥Ëº∏Á≠âÊóèÁæ§ÔºåÊàêÁÇ∫Ê≥ï‰∫∫Â∏ÉÂ±Ä1ÊúàÂçäÂ∞éÈ´îËÇ°‰∫ÆÈªûÔºåÂª∫Ë≠∞ÊäïË≥á‰∫∫ÂèØÊìáÂÑ™Â∏ÉÂ±ÄÊàñÈÄèÈÅéETFÊçïÊçâÂè∞ËÇ°ÈÄôÊ≥¢‰∏äÊº≤ÂãïËÉΩ„ÄÇ(Êñ∞ËÅû‰æÜÊ∫ê : Â∑•ÂïÜÊôÇÂ†±‰∏ÄÊ•äÊ∑®Ê∑≥ÔºèÂè∞ÂåóÂ†±Â∞é)

news.Title: „ÄäÂúãÈöõÁî¢Ê•≠„ÄãÂè∞Á©çÁæéÂª†Âà©ÊΩ§ Èù¢Ëá®ÂÖ©Â§ßÊåëÊà∞
news.Content:
„ÄêÊôÇÂ†±-Âè∞ÂåóÈõª„ÄëÂú®ÂÖ®ÁêÉ‰æõÊáâÈèàÈáçÁµÑËàá„ÄåÁæéÂúãË£ΩÈÄ†„ÄçÊîøÁ≠ñÊé®Âãï‰πã‰∏ãÔºåÂè∞Á©çÈõªÂä†ÈÄüÊì¥Â§ßÁæéÂúãÂ∏ÉÂ±ÄÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÈ´òÊòÇÁöÑÁîüÁî¢ÊàêÊú¨Ê≠£Â∞çÁç≤Âà©ËÉΩÂäõÂΩ¢ÊàêÊòéÈ°ØÂ£ìÂäõ„ÄÇWccftechÁ∂≤Á´ôÂºïÁî®SemiAnalysisË≥áÊñôÊåáÂá∫ÔºåÂè∞Á©çÈõªÂú®ÁæéÂúãË®≠Âª†ÂæåÔºåÂñÆ‰ΩçÊô∂ÂúìÊØõÂà©ÁéáËàáÂè∞ÁÅ£Áõ∏ÊØîÂá∫ÁèæÂ∑®Â§ßËêΩÂ∑ÆÔºå‰∏ªÂõ†Âú®Êñº‰∫∫ÂäõÊàêÊú¨ËàáÊô∂ÂúìÊäòËàäË≤ªÁî®Â§ßÂπÖÊîÄÂçá„ÄÇ

Ê†πÊìöÂàÜÊûêÂ∏´ÂΩôÊï¥ÁöÑÊï∏ÊìöÔºåÂè∞Á©çÈõªÂè∞ÁÅ£Êô∂ÂúìÂª†ÊØèÁâáÊô∂ÂúìÁöÑ‰∫∫ÂäõÊàêÊú¨Á¥Ñ1,800ÁæéÂÖÉÔºåÁæéÂúãÊô∂ÂúìÂª†ÂâáÈ´òÈÅî3,600ÁæéÂÖÉÔºåÊï¥Êï¥È´òÂá∫1ÂÄç„ÄÇÂú®Êô∂ÂúìÊäòËàäÊñπÈù¢Â∑ÆË∑ùÊõ¥ÁÇ∫È©ö‰∫∫ÔºåÂè∞ÁÅ£Âª†ÊØèÁâáÊô∂ÂúìÊäòËàäË≤ªÁî®Á¥Ñ1,500ÁæéÂÖÉÔºåÁæéÂúãÂª†ÂçªÈ´òÈÅî7,289ÁæéÂÖÉÔºåÊòØÂè∞ÁÅ£Âª†ÁöÑ4ÂÄç‰ª•‰∏ä„ÄÇÂèóÊ≠§ÂΩ±ÈüøÔºåÂè∞ÁÅ£Êô∂ÂúìÂª†ÂñÆÁâáÊô∂ÂúìÊØõÂà©ÁéáÁ¥Ñ62ÔºÖÔºåÁæéÂúãÊô∂ÂúìÂª†ÂÉÖÁ¥Ñ8ÔºÖÔºåÂπæ‰πéÂè™Ââ©ÂÖ´ÂàÜ‰πã‰∏Ä„ÄÇ

ÊâÄË¨ÇÊô∂ÂúìÊäòËàäÔºåÊåáÁöÑÊòØÊô∂ÂúìÂª†Âª∫Ë®≠ËàáË®≠ÂÇôÊäïË≥áÂú®‰ΩøÁî®Âπ¥ÈôêÂÖßÁöÑÊàêÊú¨Êî§Êèê„ÄÇÁî±ÊñºÁæéÂúãÊô∂ÂúìÂª†Áî¢ËÉΩË¶èÊ®°ËàáÁî¢ËÉΩÂà©Áî®ÁéáÁõ∏Â∞çËºÉ‰ΩéÔºåÂç≥‰æøÊé°Áî®Áõ∏ÂêåË£ΩÁ®ãÊäÄË°ìÔºåÂñÆ‰ΩçÁî¢Âá∫ÁöÑÂõ∫ÂÆöÊàêÊú¨ÂçªÂøÖÈ†àÁî±Êõ¥Â∞ëÁöÑÊô∂ÂúìÂàÜÊî§ÔºåÂ∞éËá¥ÊØèÁâáÊô∂ÂúìÊâøÊìîÊõ¥È´òÁöÑ„ÄåÂõ∫ÂÆöË≤ªÁî®„ÄçÔºåÈÄ≤‰∏ÄÊ≠•‰æµËùïÊØõÂà©Á©∫Èñì„ÄÇ

Ê≠§Â§ñÔºåÁæéÂúãÈ´òÊòÇÁöÑ‰∫∫ÂäõÊàêÊú¨‰∫¶ÊàêÁÇ∫Ê≤âÈáçË≤†Êìî„ÄÇÁÇ∫ÊîØÊíêÁæéÂúãÊô∂ÂúìÂª†ÈÅã‰ΩúÔºåÂè∞Á©çÈõªÂøÖÈ†àË¶ÅÂú®ËÅòÁî®Áï∂Âú∞Âì°Â∑•ËàáÂæûÂè∞ÁÅ£Ê¥æÈÅ£Â∑•Á®ãÂ∏´‰πãÈñìÂÅöÂá∫ÂèñÊç®„ÄÇÁÑ°Ë´ñÊé°Âèñ‰ΩïÁ®ÆÊñπÂºèÔºåÊï¥È´îÁî®‰∫∫ÊàêÊú¨ÁöÜÊòéÈ°ØÈ´òÈÅéÊñºÂè∞ÁÅ£ÔºåÊàêÁÇ∫ÂΩ±ÈüøÁáüÈÅãÊïàÁéáÁöÑÈáçË¶ÅÂõ†Á¥†„ÄÇ

Â∏ÇÂ†¥‰∫∫Â£´ÊåáÂá∫ÔºåÈÄô‰πüÊòØÂè∞Á©çÈõª‰∫ûÂà©Ê°ëÈÇ£Â∑ûÊô∂ÂúìÂª†ËøëÊúüÂá∫ÁèæÁç≤Âà©‰∏ãÊªëÁöÑ‰∏ªË¶ÅÂéüÂõ†„ÄÇÂú®Âª∫Âª†ÊàêÊú¨„ÄÅÁáüÈÅãË≤ªÁî®ËàáÊäòËàäÂ£ìÂäõÂêåÊ≠•ÊîæÂ§ßÁöÑÊÉÖÊ≥Å‰∏ãÔºåÁæéÂúãÁîüÁî¢Êô∂ÁâáÁöÑÁ∂ìÊøüÊÄß‰ªçÊúâÂæÖÊôÇÈñìËàáË¶èÊ®°ÊîæÂ§ß‰æÜÊîπÂñÑ„ÄÇ

ÂÑòÁÆ°Áü≠ÊúüÊØõÂà©ÊâøÂ£ìÔºåÂè∞Á©çÈõªÊé®ÈÄ≤ÁæéÂúãÂ∏ÉÂ±ÄÁöÑÊà∞Áï•ÊÑèÁæ©‰æùÁÑ∂ÊòéÁ¢∫„ÄÇÊ≠§ËàâÊúâÂä©ÊñºÂàÜÊï£Âú∞Á∑£ÊîøÊ≤ªÈ¢®Èö™ÔºåÁ¢∫‰øùÈóúÈçµÂÆ¢Êà∂Âú®‰∏çÂêåÂú∞ÂçÄÈÉΩËÉΩÂèñÂæóÁ©©ÂÆöÁî¢ËÉΩÔºå‰πüÁç≤ÂæóÂåÖÊã¨ËºùÈÅîÂú®ÂÖßÁöÑÈáçË¶ÅÂÆ¢Êà∂ÊîØÊåÅ„ÄÇ

Ê•≠ÁïåÊôÆÈÅçË™çÁÇ∫ÔºåÂª∫Á´ãÂÖ∑ÈüåÊÄßÁöÑÁæéÂúãÂçäÂ∞éÈ´î‰æõÊáâÈèàÊòØ‰∏ÄÈ†ÖÈï∑ÊúüÂ∑•Á®ãÔºåÂè∞Á©çÈõªÂã¢ÂøÖÂú®ÊàêÊú¨ËàáÊà∞Áï•‰πãÈñìÊåÅÁ∫åÊ¨äË°°Ôºå‰ΩÜÁæéÂúãÊì¥Áî¢ÊñπÂêëÁü≠ÊúüÂÖß‰∏çÊúÉÊîπËÆä„ÄÇ(Êñ∞ËÅû‰æÜÊ∫ê : Â∑•ÂïÜÊôÇÂ†±‰∏ÄÈô≥Á©éËäÉÔºèÁ∂úÂêàÂ§ñÈõªÂ†±Â∞é)

news.Title: „ÄäÂêÑÂ†±Ë¶ÅËÅû„ÄãCESÊñ∞Êô∂ÁâáÊãöÂ†¥ Âè∞Á©çÈõªÂ§ßË¥èÂÆ∂
news.Content:
„ÄêÊôÇÂ†±-Âè∞ÂåóÈõª„ÄëCES 2026Êñº6Êó•Ëá≥9Êó•Âú®ÊãâÊñØÁ∂≠Âä†ÊñØÁôªÂ†¥ÔºåÂè∞Á©çÈõªÂèóÊÉ†ÂÖàÈÄ≤Ë£ΩÁ®ãÂÑ™Âã¢ÔºåÂÖ®Èù¢ÊâøÊé•AMD„ÄÅËã±ÁâπÁàæÔºàIntelÔºâËàáËºùÈÅîÔºàNVIDIAÔºâAIÊ†∏ÂøÉÊô∂ÁâáË®ÇÂñÆÔºå2026Âπ¥Áî¢ËÉΩÊåÅÁ∫åÁúã‰øè„ÄÇÂçäÂ∞éÈ´îÊ•≠ËÄÖÊåáÂá∫ÔºåÂÖ®ÁêÉÂ∑®È†≠ÊøÄÊà∞AIÂØ¶Âäõ‰∏ãÔºåÂè∞Á©çÈõªÂ∑≤Á´ãÊñº‰∏çÊïó‰πãÂú∞ÔºåÂ†™Á®±Â±ïÂ†¥Â§ñÊúÄÂ§ßË¥èÂÆ∂„ÄÇ

‰ªäÂπ¥CESÂ§ßÊúÉÂª∂Á∫å„ÄåAI Everywhere„Äç‰∏ªËª∏ÔºåÁÑ¶ÈªûÈáçÂõûÁµÇÁ´ØAI PCÊáâÁî®„ÄÇÂú®Ë®òÊÜ∂È´îÊàêÊú¨È´òÊº≤ÁöÑÊåëÊà∞‰∏ãÔºåCPUËàáGPUÂ∑®È†≠Â¶Ç‰ΩïÈÄèÈÅéÂÖàÈÄ≤Ë£ΩÁ®ãÊèêÂçáÈÅãÁÆóÊïàÁéáÔºåÊàêËßÄÂØü2026Âπ¥PCÁî¢Ê•≠Âæ©Áî¶ÂãïËÉΩËàáÊäÄË°ìÊºîÈÄ≤ÁöÑÈóúÈçµÊåáÊ®ô„ÄÇ

AMDÂü∑Ë°åÈï∑ËòáÂßø‰∏∞Â∞áÁôºË°®‰∏ªÈ°åÊºîË¨õÔºåÁÇ∫Â§ßÊúÉÊè≠ÈñãÂ∫èÂπïÔºåËºùÈÅîÂü∑Ë°åÈï∑ÈªÉ‰ªÅÂã≥ÂâáËÅöÁÑ¶Ê©üÂô®‰∫∫ËàáËªäÁî®Ëß£Ê±∫ÊñπÊ°àÔºåÂ±ïÁ§∫AIÂä†ÈÄüÈÅãÁÆóÂú®Â§öÂÖÉÂ†¥ÂüüÁöÑÊáâÁî®ÔºõÈ´òÈÄöÂäõÊé®AI PCËàáAIoTÊáâÁî®„ÄÇÂú®Ë®òÊÜ∂È´î‰æõÊáâÂêÉÁ∑ä‰∏ãÔºåÊô∂ÁâáÊ•≠ËÄÖÈáçÂøÉÂ∑≤ËΩâÂêëÁ≥ªÁµ±ÊïàÁéáËàáË≥áÊ∫êÂÑ™Âåñ„ÄÇ

news.Title: Tesla (TSLA) Is Down 7.8% After BYD Takes EV Crown And Deliveries Fall Again - What's Changed
news.Content:
Tesla (TSLA) Is Down 7.8% After BYD Takes EV Crown And Deliveries Fall Again - What's Changed

Simply Wall St
Sun, January 4, 2026 at 3:16 PM PST 3 min read

In this article: TSLA

BYDDF

In early January 2026, Tesla reported Q4 2025 production of 434,358 vehicles and deliveries of 418,227, bringing full‚Äëyear deliveries to 1.64 million, its second consecutive annual sales decline and confirming that China‚Äôs BYD has overtaken it as the world‚Äôs largest EV seller.
This shift signals a maturing EV market where Tesla‚Äôs core automotive volumes face mounting competition and weaker incentives, even as its fast‚Äëgrowing energy storage and autonomy efforts gain more investor attention.
We‚Äôll now examine how Tesla‚Äôs back‚Äëto‚Äëback delivery declines and loss of global EV leadership to BYD affect its existing investment narrative.

Trump's oil boom is here - pipelines are primed to profit. Discover the 22 US stocks riding the wave .
Tesla Investment Narrative Recap To own Tesla today, you have to believe it can evolve from a slowing EV manufacturer into a broader AI, autonomy and energy platform, with software and storage eventually doing more of the heavy lifting than cars. The latest delivery miss and Tesla‚Äôs loss of the EV crown to BYD directly challenge the near term automotive volume story, but do not yet change the key short term catalyst: progress on robotaxi and FSD approvals, particularly outside the U.S., or the biggest current risk of demand and margin pressure as incentives roll off.

Against that backdrop, Tesla‚Äôs record energy storage deployments and the new 500 MW / 1 GWh Matrix Renewables battery deal in the UK underline why many shareholders now watch the energy business almost as closely as vehicle deliveries. These projects show how grid storage could help offset some of the cyclicality and incentive sensitivity of car sales, even if it is still early days for energy to carry the valuation narrative.
Yet, despite this shift, investors still need to be aware that weaker EV demand and shrinking incentives could...
Read the full narrative on Tesla (it's free!)
Tesla's narrative projects $148.1 billion revenue and $15.4 billion earnings by 2028.
Uncover how Tesla's forecasts yield a $391.35 fair value , a 11% downside to its current price.

Exploring Other Perspectives The 211 fair value estimates from the Simply Wall St Community span roughly US$67 to over US$2,700 per share, reflecting sharply different views on Tesla‚Äôs long term potential. Against this, Tesla‚Äôs recent back to back delivery declines and reduced U.S. incentives show why it can help to compare several competing growth and risk assumptions before deciding how its earnings story might evolve.

news.Title: Broadcom (AVGO): Assessing Valuation After Recent Share Price Softness and Multi‚ÄëYear Run
news.Content:
Broadcom (AVGO): Assessing Valuation After Recent Share Price Softness and Multi‚ÄëYear Run

Simply Wall St
Sun, January 4, 2026 at 3:16 PM PST 2 min read

In this article: AVGO

Broadcom (AVGO) has been drifting after its recent pullback, and that softer price action is what has traders watching the stock more closely now, especially in light of its strong multi year track record.
See our latest analysis for Broadcom.
Recent softness in Broadcom‚Äôs share price, including a double digit 30 day share price return decline, comes after a powerful multi year run. Total shareholder returns over one year and beyond still signal strong underlying momentum rather than a broken story.

If Broadcom‚Äôs surge has you thinking about what else could surprise to the upside, this is a good moment to explore high growth tech and AI stocks as potential next wave beneficiaries.
Against a backdrop of robust earnings growth and a sizeable gap to analyst targets, investors now face a key question: Is Broadcom still trading below its true potential, or has the market already priced in the next leg of growth?
Most Popular Narrative: 13.9% Undervalued Compared to Broadcom‚Äôs last close at $347.62, the most followed narrative anchors on a higher fair value, hinting at still untapped upside.
Read the complete narrative.
Curious how such aggressive growth, expanding margins, and a rich future earnings multiple can still add up to upside at a 10 percent discount rate? The full narrative lays out a bold roadmap that challenges what today‚Äôs price implies.
Result: Fair Value of $403.66 (UNDERVALUED)

Have a read of the narrative in full and understand what's behind the forecasts.
However, concentrated AI customer exposure and execution risk around the VMware integration could quickly challenge today‚Äôs bullish assumptions if growth or margins disappoint.
Find out about the key risks to this Broadcom narrative.
Another View: Rich Multiples, Different Message While the leading narrative sees Broadcom as 13.9 percent undervalued, its current price to earnings ratio of 71.3 times looks stretched versus the US semiconductor average of 37.3 times and a fair ratio of 55 times. This suggests meaningful downside risk if sentiment cools.
